issue.title: mytotalconnectcomfort.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
3. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
4. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
5. Tap to install
6. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
7. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
3. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
4. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
5. Tap to install
6. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
7. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots

  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

</details>

  <summary>Screenshot 3 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/sy801lsz4000s8c0s0wgkwcc4s0wcg4dje2wixxao0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

  <summary>Screenshot 5 </summary>

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221474#issuecomment-3713551660
Currently, AdGuard DNS does not block the domains by anti-phishing or filters list.
It seems that filters list maintainer needs to forward to AdGuard's DNS department.

issue.title: Fix #221926 AS
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

issue.title: Fix #221926 AS
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [x] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Fix #221926
Fix #221971
Fix #221981
Fix #222024
Fix #222025
Fix #222026
Fix #222021
Fix #222027

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: Added, thanks.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hmm... That's strange. Can you backup (`Expore settings`) your Adguard's configurations, then reset Adguard to default settings and check if the custom rules can be added?

Then try to restore (`Import settings`) the configurations and see if can still add the custom rules or not.

issue.title: Fix #221926 AS
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [x] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Fix #221926
Fix #221971
Fix #221981
Fix #222024
Fix #222025
Fix #222026
Fix #222021
Fix #222027

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots

</details>
<details>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

comment.body:
Thanks for confirming that Naver domains aren't blocked by your filters.

Since you mentioned this needs to be forwarded to AdGuard's DNS department, quick question:

**Should I continue this discussion here in this GitHub repo, or is there a different channel for DNS infrastructure issues?**

If there's a more appropriate place for this (support ticket, different repo, direct contact with DNS team, etc.), please let me know and I'll follow up there.

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/l12z5xty3tsk004k8000skoks8w80wsb2r994pz5r4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/16ho0xijiiw0g4w8gookogko4g4ss0kphwb4855j00.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/l12z5xty3tsk004k8000skoks8w80wsb2r994pz5r4.jpg?nc=1)

can't reproduce the issue,try updating filters & disable other similar extensions eg i see Avast.avast might include adblocking that might cause issues.
also the video streaming server frequently changes its domains.

issue.title: tuoitre.vn
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://tuoitre.vn](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftuoitre.vn) ### Comment > Hello AdGuard Team, > > Our domain https://js.aiservice.vn/rec is part of a recommendation service that provides contextual content recommendations for publishers. > > Currently, this service is being used on the following website: > > https://tuoitre.vn/ > > The service does not: > > serve intrusive or disruptive advertisements > > perform cross-site tracking > > use fingerprinting or similar tracking techniques > > All recommended or sponsored content is clearly labeled, and the system operates in a privacy-friendly manner. > > We believe that the following blocking rule is a false positive, especially when applied to tuoitre.vn: > > Blocked rule: > ||js.aiservice.vn^ > > Filter list: > AdGuard Mobile Ads > > We kindly request that you review this rule and consider removing or exempting it for https://tuoitre.vn/. > > Thank you very much for your time and consideration. > > Best regards, > Thanh Phan ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bqinqev3p48oksc8gswk4ww88oskgckrdfol1flpcg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/laim30jjwlwo0k4cwwgwwc004o084gkq9hqjegsvr4.png?nc=1)

AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads,
EasyList Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=win&product_version=2.12.250&system_version=Window11&browser=chrome&filters=101.2.11&dns.enabled=false&browsing_security.enabled=true&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false&win.wfp=true)

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

comment.body:
On my end it's caused by `AdGuard Popup Blocker` userscript. Could you please add following rule to user rules (in AdGuard app for Windows): ```adblock @@||uin-sports.pt^$extension='AdGuard Popup Blocker'|'AdGuard Popup Blocker (Beta)' ``` and then check if issue still occurs? By the way, if you use AdGuard app then extension is not necessary and it might interfere with app, so I recommend to use only app (or just extension). One more thing is that we don't know your AdGuard app configuration. If the rule above does not work, please send report through AdGuard assistant.
Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/l12z5xty3tsk004k8000skoks8w80wsb2r994pz5r4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/16ho0xijiiw0g4w8gookogko4g4ss0kphwb4855j00.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/sy801lsz4000s8c0s0wgkwcc4s0wcg4dje2wixxao0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 4 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eqnqnc2iq8g8g04cw8o0ksogcg8gg48lnokjgnjwzk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 5 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 5](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/iadqmo6ipq0wocgkcwggs8o0k8ggk40tpgtxpyimsg.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oljxujs1sn4w8swck4okwgow4ssswk0e96d8hnp0f4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/tkvknvqico0gw4880gs0kcokg444woseo1nz2b8zfc.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 3 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/6s32hb49exgc48k8kcowg04ogowgcowbz4xhkisev4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | `Android 16`
Browser: | Chrome

comment.body: If someone experiences a similar issue in the future, can you ask them to get what the value is at `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/info.txt` in a web browser (e.g., Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox) with what AdGuard DNS (DNS over TLS) in Android system setting is disabled?
